definition: to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
variant of 逼[bi1]/to compel/to pressure

sentences.english: The enemy was advancing. The snow was stained with blood.
sentences.chinese: 首都被迫弃守，敌人步步进逼，鲜血将白雪浸染。

sentences.english: Leaning toward each other bit by bit.
The two advanced on him with clenched fists.
sentences.chinese: 这两人紧握拳头向他进逼过来。
这两人紧握拳头向他进逼过来。
拿破仑的军队进逼莫斯科。

sentences.english: The demonstrators fled when soldiers toting machine guns advanced on the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 当持有机枪的士兵向人群进逼时，示威者逃散了。

sentences.english: He even pushed as far as Embrun.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至敢于进逼昂布伦。

sentences.english: Soldiers moved in on the well-defended old house from all sides.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们从四面八方进逼那所防守严密的老房子。

sentences.english: The troops were firing away at the advancing enemy.
sentences.chinese: 部队连续不断地向步步进逼的敌人开火。

sentences.english: Enemy troops in overwhelming numbers were converging on the reich .
sentences.chinese: 敌军正以压倒优势的兵力，从四面八方向帝国进逼。

definition: to invade
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
to retreat in defeat
to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to attack and seize
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
to attack violently/to storm
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to attack jointly
in command of the army
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
